titleStmt.title: C. L. McConnell et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8844

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To His Excellency, Hon James F. Robinson.

The undersigned would respectfully represent that John I. Williamson ^of Cattlettsburg^ went the security on a recognizance bond of Joseph McKinney, for $250,,00, to appear before the circuit court at Boyd County ^in its April Term 1862^ to answer the charge of Horse Stealing. Said Williamson did not know the Deft. further than that he was a Union Home Guard, & believeing that it a was a Secession persecution maliciously set on foot against him, he went his bail. McKinney did not deny takeing a horse, but said he done it in the service of his country in whose cause he was engaged fighting. McKinney afterwards left with the army & has not since been heard from & it is not therefore known whether he has been killed or not -- Under these circumstances ^the bail Bond was forfeited Apl 1863^ we pray your Excellency to remit the forfeiture as we believe it to be a case that deserves your clemency & Executive interposition. Mr Williamson being a poor man

C L McConnell Judge Boyd County Court
Laben L Moore Special Judge
J. S. Drury, Comth Atty.
Jas M Riely Clk Boyd Circuit Court
John H. Eastham
Sheriff. Boyd Co.

Boyd Cir. Ct
$250. } Forfeiture
The fine in this case is remitted
J F Robinson
J. J. Williamson
Hand remission to Mr Miller
Issd May 14th 1863.
